image.altText: A photo of Pope Francis in a frame.

props.synopsis: The former leader of the Catholic Church's Truth, Justice and Healing Council says Pope Francis's leadership centred on inclusion and diversity, not judgement â€” and that progressive approach created some enemies among Australia's clerical elite.

title.children: Some Catholics anxious about church without Pope Francis holding the reins

image.altText: A woman with short white hair in a navy blue and white stripped button-down shirt stands on a footpath smiling.

props.synopsis: For Deb Stevens Burrangiri aged care respite facility in Canberra's south was a "lifeline" as her mother's dementia progressed, but the ACT's Health Minister says it's unlikely the facility will be the recipient of a promised $10 million federal funding boost should an Albanese government be re-elected.

title.children: Deb wants her 'lifeline' funded but the health minister say it's unlikely

image.altText: Three young women performing a double dutch jump rope routine which includes a backflip.

props.synopsis: Most people know rope skipping as a playground activity, but for 12-year-olds Ella Pratley and Heath Malligan it's a highly competitive and technical sport they're preparing to represent Australia in on the world stage.

title.children: The 12-year-olds preparing to represent Australia in jump rope

image.altText: Archbishop Charles Balvo

props.synopsis: The late Pope Francis is remembered as "charitable" leader by members of the Catholic Church in Canberra.

title.children: Catholic leaders in Canberra remember Pope Francis as a 'compassionate' leader

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The thief stole a bike, a laptop, a saxophone and a guitar. But it all came tumbling down when the owner of a stolen iPad used the Find My iPad function.Â

title.children: Thief comes unstuck because of Find My iPad app

image.altText: Ted Mulry Gang

props.synopsis: Every week, Sunday night six o'clock, Australians settled down to watch a show so famous even King Charles III made an appearance.

title.children: One in five Australians used to watch this show. Now clips thought lost forever have been found

image.altText: An outdoor festival entrance with lettering over the top that reads "National Folk Festival".

props.synopsis: Thousands of people turn out in Canberra for the 59th annual National Folk Festival, with acts ranging from Scottish fiddlers and poetry readings, to folk dancing and a music quiz show.Â

title.children: National Folk Festival 'steering true' after facing financial difficulties

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: ACT residents will be voting for both their House of Representatives member and their two Senate representatives in the federal election on Saturday May 3.

title.children: Voting in the ACT this federal election? Here's what you should know

image.altText: A bishop in full robes.

props.synopsis: Mykola Bychok is the youngest cardinal in the Catholic Church and the only one with a link to Australia. He will join the conclave to elect a new pope.

title.children: Most cardinals are in their 70s. Australia's is the youngest

image.altText: a man wearing a suit arriving at a court and looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The former SAS soldier has accused Nine journalist Nick McKenzie of improper access to his legal strategy during the long-running defamation case.

title.children: Journalist using lawyers as 'shield', Roberts-Smith's lawyers say

image.altText: A sign of Kate Hook with two stakes in her face

props.synopsis: Two candidates for the federal seat of Calare believe their campaign posters may have been damaged by people who have "an issue with a woman running in the election".

title.children: 'Violent' vandalism targets women vying for election in NSW's west

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a Medicare card as he speaks animatedly.

props.synopsis: Time and time again, the Coalition has been forced to deny claims about plans to privatise Australia's healthcare system.

title.children: PM has been brandishing a Medicare card and Dutton is reaping what he sowed

image.altText: A man rests with his hands on the floor of a gym, with dumbbells near him and a woman walking past.

props.synopsis: Online "masculinity" content is mainstream and wide-ranging â€” far broader than the toxic Andrew Tate style manosphere or incel culture touched on in the hit Netflix series Adolescence.

title.children: New data on masculinity influencers a 'wake-up call' to all Australians

image.altText: Four women in traditional attire stand next to a portrait of JD Vance

props.synopsis: Despite warm relations with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump has slammed the South Asian country as a "tariff abuser".

title.children: 'Prosperous and peaceful': JD Vance calls on India to buy more F-35 fighters

image.altText: Noah Balta yells and points with his left hand

props.synopsis: The AFL does not pull punches when it comes to on-field incidents, but its soft handling of the Noah Balta case shows it is time to get just as serious about matters off the field.

title.children: Balta verdict a lesson from real court to AFL about off-field incidents

image.altText: a ute in water

props.synopsis: The ACCC alleges that in advertising cars driving through water and rough terrains, LDV has misrepresented their "durability".

title.children: Consumer watchdog takes LDV to court over 'rust and corrosion' concerns

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Sydney's beloved Asian elephant pair is preparing for a new life with a herd on the plains of South Australia.

title.children: After a century in Sydney, Taronga Zoo says goodbye to its elephants

image.altText: An out of focus man looks at plants while pushing a trolley in a nursery.

props.synopsis: Bunnings plant suppliers will now have written agreements under a new statement of principles designed to protect growers, following complaints about the hardware giant during last year's supermarket inquiry.

title.children: Bunnings strikes deal addressing concerns of 'terrified' plant growers

image.altText: A graphic featuring post-it notes and cash imposed over a map of NSW

props.synopsis: Housing affordability weighs heavily on voters in a NSW Central Coast seat that has been won by the party that goes on to form government at every election since 1983.

title.children: For more than 40 years, whoever wins this seat wins the election

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: Police walking an arrested individual to a van

props.synopsis: Four people, including a patched member of the Rebels Outlaw Motorcycle Gang, are arrested as part of a police operation into an alleged drug trafficking syndicate in regional Victoria.

title.children: Rebels biker arrested in alleged million-dollar meth bust

image.altText: Lori Vallow Daybell wears her hair out with a concerned look on her face.

props.synopsis: This is the Idaho murderer's fourth life sentence after she was already convicted in Idaho in the killings of her two youngest children and a romantic rival.

title.children: 'Doomsday mum' convicted of conspiring to kill estranged husband

image.altText: A small boy places a candle at a tribute on beach, full of flowers, candles and a teddy bear.

props.synopsis: The family of a nine-year-old boy who died after becoming trapped between beach rocks on Easter Sunday say they are overwhelmed by the community's show of support.

title.children: Hundreds attend beach vigil after boy's tragic death on Easter Sunday

image.altText: The top of a hospital bed and monitor.

props.synopsis: Queensland's new government has announced it will overhaul the state's hospital expansion plan, promising to deliver 2,600 beds. But it won't yet reveal the cost or time frame.

title.children: Queensland government throws out 'deeply flawed' hospital plan

image.altText: A person places a vote in a Senate ballot box for Canberra.

props.synopsis: More than 500,000 votes were cast in the first day of early voting on Tuesday, as the trend continues of more Australians heading to the ballot box before the official polling day.

title.children: Early voters smash first day record

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines planeÂ on the tarmac at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has promised to allow overseas airlines to fly domestic routes between Darwin and the east coast if it wins government. But would that reduce prices?

title.children: The Coalition has a plan to lower Darwin airfares, but can it work?

props.synopsis:

title.children: Will this election decide our energy future?

image.altText: A crashed car on a stretch of highway. Ared car nearby and a fire truck.

props.synopsis: No bail application for a Sunshine Coast man facing 15 charges over a fatal crash, shooting and string of alleged carjackings on Monday.

title.children: Driver accused of fatal Sunshine Coast carjackings to stay behind bars

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing. The family of a baby who died 42 hours after being "violently shaken" by his father has been left with "silence, grief and an emptiness that will never fully go away", a court has heard.

title.children: Family tells court of ongoing pain over death of 'innocent, defenceless' baby

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: Experts' practical advice on keeping mozzies away when you're outdoors or at home.

title.children: How to avoid serious mosquito-borne viruses like Japanese encephalitis

props.synopsis: After the death of Pope Francis, Catholics around the world are reckoning with the future of the church. Australia's congregation has been shifting and changing with the times.

title.children: The percentage of Catholics in Australia is headed for an all-time low

image.altText: An aerial view of cars packed into a suburban development.

props.synopsis: McEwen is part new suburbs, part rural towns and part established suburbs, and it is a seat the Liberal Party will be working to take from Labor in the coming election.

title.children: Choked roads a major issue for voters in Melbourne's north

image.altText: An artists image of a white-water facility.

props.synopsis: Opponents of a whitewater centre planned for south-east Queensland say they've "drawn the short straw" on Olympic venues.

title.children: 'It's got no water': Councillors and locals question Olympic canoe venue

image.altText: A black and white photo of Australian cricketer Keith Stackpole.

props.synopsis: Former Australia Test opener Keith Stackpole dies, aged 84, after a dynamic career including seven centuries and a brilliant Ashes double ton.

title.children: Keith Stackpole remembered as 'a fantastic cricketer and a great bloke'

image.altText: festival at night

props.synopsis: Music lovers who wanted to be a part of history by attending the supposed final edition of the Bluesfest in Byron Bay are angry to hear the festival will return next year.Â

title.children: Punters at final Bluesfest feel 'betrayed' as festival renewed for 2026
